next_steps.note: "Brainstorm 3-5 potential themes or subjects for the poetry (e.g., nature, loss, love, city life). Add these to the 'Ideas' list.",
"Research and read 5-10 poems by poets whose style resonates with the desired direction for this project. Document key stylistic elements observed.",
"Write a 'seed' poem â€“ a short, rough draft (8-12 lines) exploring one of the brainstormed themes. Add to 'Progress' as 'Seed Poem Draft'.",
"Define 3-5 specific poetic devices or forms to experiment with (e.g., sonnet, haiku, free verse, alliteration). Add to 'Ideas'.",
"Identify potential resources for feedback (writing group, trusted friend, online forum) and plan a time to share initial work for critique."
"Brainstorm 3 potential themes or subjects for new poems, documenting each with at least 5 keywords.",
"Review existing drafts (if any) and identify one poem for focused revision, prioritizing clarity and imagery.",
"Research 2-3 poets whose style resonates with the project's intended direction; note specific techniques to emulate or avoid.",
"Dedicate 30 minutes to freewriting - simply write continuously about *anything* to overcome potential creative block.",
"Define the desired length and form (e.g., free verse, sonnet, haiku) for the next poem to be drafted."
